text: so Tom and I we got together around 2004
he had sustained an injury and wasn't
really responding to traditional therapy
he was receiving so that's when we got
together and worked on him and got him
better really quick and we've been
together ever since
[Music]
so my Master's is in traditional Chinese
medicine so you know that's how you know
I when I graduated school I really loved
sports and and that's kind of how I got
into it and developed you know the
technique that's been today become known
as the tv12 method you know we you know
got that better and then he would
sustain other injuries and he'd call me
I'd come back out and work on those and
fix those and then he sustained an
injury that they thought they were gonna
have to do surgery on and and he didn't
want to have to do surgery on it and
called me and I said I think we you know
we can fix this fairly quickly so I went
out to where he was and spent three days
with him and got it fixed and he never
had an issue with it again after they
told me 200 percent needed surgery so I
think at that point it kinda really
clicked with him and he's like okay this
is this is really what I'm gonna be
doing for the rest of my career and so
during the course of the season its
daily and it's multiple times a day so
we'll get together do something in the
morning kind of just get everything
activated and warmed up and ready for
the day and we'll do pre practice where
we'll start to warm up and activate all
the muscles that he's going to have to
use or in the course of practice and
then post practice we do it again to
kind of lock in these muscle memory
patterns from what he was the way that
he was moving during practice so yeah so
we come up with all of his nutritional
guidelines and protocols and so you know
what he takes for his smoothie in the
morning to you know how many times he's
gonna take a protein shake during the
course of the day - you know what his
lunch and dinner meals are gonna be how
many calories they are and how many of
those calories are gonna come from the
plant-based or essential fats or you
know some sort of animal protein so it
just depends
on time of year and what we're trying to
accomplish Tom and I have worked on
together over the past you know 12 years
we've been doing things it's kind of
morphed right because it it is so
customizable you know what I started
with 20 plus years ago when I first
started - what we incorporate and do now
are different you know as I started to
work with a lot of the athletes from the
rehab perspective side I would rehab
them they would go out and I did get
reinjure they'd come back out rehab them
again they'd go out and get Rindge and I
thought yeah why are they getting
reinjure do I need to go watch them move
and so as I began to go then go out and
watch them actually move I began to see
biomechanical imbalances and I thought
oh okay so now that's the way he wants
to move I need to train him right for
those movement patterns and once I
started to do that athletes stopped to
stop getting hurt in that same way and
so that's kind of how it morphed into
what it is today
